intro: Cremnobates ilicina, commonly known as the silky bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cremnobates ilicina is often used in coastal landscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
